intro: Astrocaryum tucumoides, commonly known as tucumã-preto, is a member of the Arecaceae family native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a tall, slender palm tree that can grow up to 20 meters in height, characterized by its dark green, pinnate leaves. The plant produces large, clustered inflorescences with yellowish flowers, followed by dark purple to black, elongated fruits. Its fruits are edible and have a high oil content, making them valuable for both local consumption and industrial uses. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
